newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares rally off new low, end up.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares rally off new low, end up.

text.p: A Tuesday afternoon rally spurred by improved sentiment for Wall Street and blue chip bargain hunting saw Singapore shares claw back an 18-point plunge to end the day slightly firmer.
"There was a bit of concensus this afternoon that the Dow might rebound after falling 300 points over the last two trading days so that helped move the index up," a local dealer said.
"There's a bit of bargain hunting going on -- I don't think this is the start of a major rebound," another said.
At Tuesday's end, Singapore's key Straits Times Industrials Index was up 1.67 on Monday's close to stand at 2,074.67.
The rally, following a plunge to a new year low of 2,055.41, was fuelled by blue chip counters led by Fraser & Neave, up Singapore $0.40 at S$12.20, and Keppel Corp up S$0.15 at S$9.25.

Singapore Press foreign stock was top of 140 gainers, up S$0.60 to S$26.90 largely on positive news about Singapore's newly liberalising telecommunications market in which the firm has a stake in a cellular and paging network.
Leading 240 losers was UOB Bank's foreign share tranche, down S$0.60 at S$14.40.
Total traded volume on Tuesday was a thin 143.0 million shares.
